channel.title: Columb Force Question, Please Help
channel.description:
[b]1. The problem statement, all variables and given/known data[/b]
The figure shows two 5.0 g spheres suspended from 1.0-m-long threads. The spheres repel each other after being charged to +31 nC. What is the angle θ ? [IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/9fs3gh.jpg[/img]
[b]2. Relevant equations[/b]
[IMG]http://upload.wikimedia.org/math/e/1/6/e16f4b0bf23cd9354b492e3581cf9d0f.png[/img]
[b]3. The attempt at a solution[/b]
i tried it by writing equation in the x and y component for one of the ball and then i would have two unknowns tension and the radius.
now for sin (theta) = r/1 cos (theta) = sqrt(1-r^2)
so for the columbs force the radius would be 2r.
now i solved for r = 4.4108*10^(-5)
this doesn't make sense, i would get the angle to be 2.53*10^(-3)
but the choice for the angles are : [IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/k1ey61.jpg[/img]
Thanks for helping

item.title: Columb Force Question, Please Help
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

That picture helps.

Read full topic

item.title: Columb Force Question, Please Help
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:2, topic:339805”]i tried to do it but got stuck with the unknown radius and angle. i think it involves solving a simultaneous equation, but i’m not sure how exactly.

one thing you didn’t do though, is take into account the downward force (W=mg).

i tried substituting in the angles they gave to work out the required forces and actual forces for each, but got bored after doing all the actual forces and one of the required forces. just knowing the answer wont really help though…[/quote]

i did, i did a fbd and did all of that

Read full topic

item.title: Columb Force Question, Please Help
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

i tried to do it but got stuck with the unknown radius and angle. i think it involves solving a simultaneous equation, but i’m not sure how exactly.

one thing you didn’t do though, is take into account the downward force (W=mg).

i tried substituting in the angles they gave to work out the required forces and actual forces for each, but got bored after doing all the actual forces and one of the required forces. just knowing the answer wont really help though…

Read full topic

item.title: Columb Force Question, Please Help

@SETO wrote:

1. The problem statement, all variables and given/known data

The figure shows two 5.0 g spheres suspended from 1.0-m-long threads. The spheres repel each other after being charged to +31 nC. What is the angle θ ?

2. Relevant equations

3. The attempt at a solution

i tried it by writing equation in the x and y component for one of the ball and then i would have two unknowns tension and the radius.

now for sin (theta) = r/1
cos (theta) = sqrt(1-r^2)

so for the columbs force the radius would be 2r.

now i solved for r = 4.4108*10^(-5)

this doesn’t make sense, i would get the angle to be 2.53*10^(-3)

but the choice for the angles are :
